intro: Carmichaelia australis, commonly known as the New Zealand flax, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae and is characterized by its erect, herbaceous stems and lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in spring. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal and lowland areas. Carmichaelia australis is valued for its ornamental appeal and historical use in traditional Māori weaving.
